alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Currituck , the southeastern City of Chesapeake and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 245 PM EDT... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Northwest, or 10 miles northeast of South Mills, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Virginia Beach and Chesapeake around 205 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Munden, Sigma, and Pungo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
